TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable beforefieldinit SortKey extends System.Object

summary.span: 表示将字符串映射到其排序关键字的映射结果。

span.span: Represents the result of mapping a string to its sort key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 两个字符串的区分区域性的比较取决于在具有多个排序权重，包括脚本，包含字母、 类别字符串中的每个字符大小写和变音符权重。A culture-sensitive comparison of two strings depends on each character in the strings having several categories of sort weights, including script, alphabetic, case, and diacritic weights. 排序键用作的特定字符串这些权重的存储库。A sort key serves as the repository of these weights for a particular string. 方法返回 类的实例，它反映指定字符串中字符的区分区域性的映射。The method returns an instance of the class that reflects the culture-sensitive mapping of characters in a specified string. 值对象是其密钥数据，这由返回属性。The value of a object is its key data, which is returned by the property. 此键的数据包含的一系列字节进行编码的字符串、 特定于区域性的排序规则和用户指定的比较选项。This key data consists of a series of bytes that encode the string, culture-specific sorting rules, and user-specified comparison options. 使用排序键的比较包含，每个排序键中的相应密钥数据的按位比较。A comparison using sort keys consists of a bitwise comparison of the corresponding key data in each sort key. 例如，如果您通过调用带 的值的 方法来创建一个排序键，则使用该排序键的字符串比较运算不区分大小写。For example, if you create a sort key by calling the method with a value of , a string comparison operation that uses the sort key is case-insensitive. 在创建字符串的排序键之后，可通过调用静态 方法比较排序键。After you create a sort key for a string, you compare sort keys by calling the static method. 此方法执行简单的逐字节比较，因此它比 或 方法的速度快得多。This method performs a simple byte-by-byte comparison, so it is much faster than the or method. ## 性能注意事项Performance considerations 执行字符串比较时， 和 方法生成相同的结果，但它们面向不同的方案。When performing a string comparison, the and methods yield the same results, but they target different scenarios. 在高级别，方法生成每个字符串的排序键、 执行比较，然后放弃的排序键并返回比较的结果。At a high level, the method generates the sort key for each string, performs the comparison, and then discards the sort key and returns the result of the comparison. 但是，方法实际上不会生成完整的排序关键字进行比较。However, the method actually doesn't generate an entire sort key to perform the comparison. 相反，此方法将为每个字符串中的每个文本元素（即，基字符、代理项对或组合字符序列）生成关键数据。Instead, the method generates the key data for each text element (that is, base character, surrogate pair, or combining character sequence) in each string. 方法然后将相应的文本元素的键数据进行比较。The method then compares the key data for the corresponding text elements. 一旦确定比较的最终结果，操作将终止。The operation terminates as soon as the ultimate result of the comparison is determined. 计算排序密钥信息，但不创建对象。Sort key information is computed, but no object is created. 此策略是经济就性能而言，如果一次，比较这两个字符串，但将成为相同的字符串比较很多次的情况下成本高昂。This strategy is economical in terms of performance if both strings are compared once, but becomes expensive if the same strings are compared many times. 方法需要生成之前执行比较每个字符串对象。The method requires generation of a object for each string before performing the comparison. 此策略因产生很大影响性能的第一个比较的时间和内存来生成对象。This strategy is expensive in terms of performance for the first comparison because of the time and memory invested to generate the objects. 但是，它将成为经济如果相同的排序键进行比较多次。However, it becomes economical if the same sort keys are compared many times. 例如，假设你编写的应用程序在其中基于字符串的索引列与指定的搜索的字符串匹配的行的数据库表中搜索。For example, suppose you write an application that searches a database table for the row in which the string-based index column matches a specified search string. 该表包含数千行，而比较中每一行的索引的搜索字符串将花费很长时间。The table contains thousands of rows, and comparing the search string to the index in each row will take a long time. 因此，当应用程序将存储行和其索引列，它还生成并将索引的排序键存储在专用于改进搜索性能的列。Therefore, when the application stores a row and its index column, it also generates and stores the sort key for the index in a column dedicated to improving search performance. 当应用程序搜索目标行时，它会将连接到的索引字符串，而不是比较和索引字符串的搜索字符串的排序键的搜索字符串的排序键进行比较。When the application searches for a target row, it compares the sort key for the search string to the sort key for the index string, instead of comparing the search string to the index string. ## 安全注意事项Security considerations 方法返回根据指定的字符串对象与值和值，并与基础关联的区域性对象。The method returns a object with the value based on a specified string and value, and the culture associated with the underlying object. 如果安全决策取决于字符串比较或大小写更改，则您应使用固定区域性的 方法来确保操作行为的一致性，无论操作系统的区域性设置如何。If a security decision depends on a string comparison or case change, you should use the method of the invariant culture to ensure that the behavior of the operation is consistent, regardless of the culture settings of the operating system. 使用以下步骤获取排序键：Use the following steps to obtain a sort key: 1. 从 属性中检索固定区域性。Retrieve the invariant culture from the property. 2. 从 属性中检索固定区域性的 对象。Retrieve a object for the invariant culture from the property. 3. 调用 方法。Call the method. 使用 对象的值等效于调用带指定的 LCMAP_SORTKEY 值的 Windows `LCMapString` 方法。Working with the value of a object is equivalent to calling the Windows `LCMapString` method with the LCMAP_SORTKEY value specified. 但是，对于对象，英文字符的排序键位于之前朝鲜语字符的排序键。However, for the object, the sort keys for English characters precede the sort keys for Korean characters. 对象可以序列化，但仅限于，以便它们可以跨对象。 objects can be serialized, but only so that they can cross objects. 如果应用程序对 对象进行序列化，则此应用程序必须在提供了 .NET Framework 的新版本时重新生成所有排序键。If an application serializes a object, the application must regenerate all the sort keys when there is a new version of the .NET Framework. 有关排序键的详细信息，请参阅 Unicode 技术标准 #10:"Unicode 排序规则算法"上[Unicode Consortium 网站](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37123)。For more information about sort keys, see Unicode Technical Standard #10, "Unicode Collation Algorithm" on the [Unicode Consortium website](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37123). ## Examples 下面的示例使用“en-US”和“es-ES”区域性以及“en-US”和“es-ES”传统区域性比较字符串“llama”。The following example compares the string "llama" using the "en-US" and "es-ES" cultures, and the "en-US" and "es-ES" traditional cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.SortKey.Compare#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.SortKey.Compare/CPP/sortkey_compare.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.SortKey.Compare#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.SortKey.Compare/CS/sortkey_compare.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.SortKey.Compare#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.SortKey.Compare/VB/sortkey_compare.vb#1)] 下面的示例演示如何使用 类提高完全依赖于排序和搜索大型数组的应用程序中的性能。The following example shows how you can use the class to improve performance in an application that relies extensively on sorting and searching a large array. 该示例创建无序的名称数组，此实例中有 13 个元素。The example creates an unordered array of names, which in this case has 13 elements. 然后它将每个名称的排序键存储在并行数组中，后者会将其传递到 方法。It then stores the sort key of each name in a parallel array, which it passes to the method. 结果为已排序的数组。The result is a sorted array. 然后，该示例搜索三个字符串的数组。The example then searches the array for three strings. 对于每个搜索字符串，它调用 方法来检索字符串的排序键，然后调用 方法来检索该排序键在排序键数组中的索引。For each search string, it calls the method to retrieve the string's sort key, and then calls the method to retrieve the index of that sort key in the array of sort keys. 由于名称和排序键数组是并行的，因此返回的索引也是 `names` 数组中的名称的索引。Because the name and sort key arrays are parallel, the returned index is also the index of the name in the `names` array. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.SortKey.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.sortkey.class/cs/sortkey1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.SortKey.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.sortkey.class/vb/sortkey1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值为"排序关键字的"的字符串的串联、 区域性标识符和比较选项的当前对象和的值属性。The return value is the concatenation of the string "SortKey - ", the culture identifier and compare options of the current object, and the value of the property. 此方法重写 。This method overrides . ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示原始字符串，字符串后所得的方法的区分大小写和不区分大小写的排序键，并区分大小写和不区分大小写的排序键的键数据。The following code example displays an original string, the strings yielded by the method for case-sensitive and case-insensitive sort keys, and the key data for case-sensitive and case-insensitive sort keys.
